description: District Lemonade, a father–son lemonade stand in Dupont Circle, became DC's first to accept Bitcoin after a spontaneous "show me how" moment. Within minutes, their first Lightning payment was complete—turning curiosity into action and inspiring a wave of local support from the Bitcoin District community.

Banner Bee Company, a family-run honey vendor at the Dupont Farmers Market, learned to accept Bitcoin payments through a quick hands-on demo—making their first Lightning sale within minutes and showing how simple it is for local artisans to join DC's growing Bitcoin economy.

The Big Chef, a small sandwich and crêpe shop in DC's Bloomingdale neighborhood, made its first Bitcoin Lightning sale during a quick hands-on onboarding. Now proudly displaying "Bitcoin Accepted Here," the owner joins local businesses exploring Bitcoin as a new way to serve their community.

DC’s first clean, non-alcoholic bottle shop — offering functional beverages, dealcoholized wines, and plant-powered tonics with CBD, kava, cacao, and matcha. Located in Union Market, Plant Magic brings mindful drinking and community connection to the heart of the city — now accepting Bitcoin.
